entity.name: DX
entity.description: Learnability, API ergonomics (DX), cognitive overhead, things being too low-level, confusing, annoying, or a hassle.
entity.descriptionClean: Learnability, API ergonomics (DX), cognitive overhead, things being too low-level, confusing, annoying, or a hassle.

entity.name: Excessive complexity
entity.description: Too much complexity
entity.descriptionClean: Too much complexity

entity.name: Poor learnability
entity.description: High learning curve, requires too much knowledge to get started, or too much information to memorize.
entity.descriptionClean: High learning curve, requires too much knowledge to get started, or too much information to memorize.

entity.name: Excessive verbosity / Boilerplate
entity.description: APIs being overly verbose and/or requiring too much boilerplate.
entity.descriptionClean: APIs being overly verbose and/or requiring too much boilerplate.

entity.name: High effort
entity.description: Requires too much work. Includes APIs being too low-level, requiring a lot of manual developer effort to use.
entity.descriptionClean: Requires too much work. Includes APIs being too low-level, requiring a lot of manual developer effort to use.

entity.name: Difficulty managing ids
entity.description: Difficulties around creating and managing unique ids, linking to ids, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Difficulties around creating and managing unique ids, linking to ids, etc.

entity.name: Framework compatibility
entity.description: Issues around compatibility with JS frameworks.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around compatibility with JS frameworks.

entity.name: React compatibility
entity.description: Issues around compatibility with React.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around compatibility with React.

entity.name: Shadow DOM
entity.description: Encapsulate elements not visible from the outside, and style them with CSS not affecting the rest of the page.
entity.descriptionClean: Encapsulate elements not visible from the outside, and style them with CSS not affecting the rest of the page.

example.codeHighlighted: this.shadowRoot = this.attachShadow({mode: "open"});

webFeature.description_html: Shadow DOM allows you to attach encapsulated "shadow" DOM trees to elements. A shadow DOM tree is a separate component, isolated from the scripts and styles in other parts of the document. This is a part of Web Components.
webFeature.name: Shadow DOM

entity.name: Cross-root issues
entity.description: Issues around crossing shadow boundaries.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around crossing shadow boundaries.

entity.name: Cross-root element references
entity.description: Issues with element references crossing shadow boundaries, including cross-root ARIA
entity.descriptionClean: Issues with element references crossing shadow boundaries, including cross-root ARIA

entity.name: Shadow DOM without style encapsulation
entity.description: Desire for DOM encapsulation while allowing page styles to cascade into the shadow tree. For complaints about lack of adoption of `mode: open-stylable` shadow roots, combine with `browser_support`.
entity.descriptionHtml: Desire for DOM encapsulation while allowing page styles to cascade into the shadow tree. For complaints about lack of adoption of mode: open-stylable shadow roots, combine with browser_support.
entity.descriptionClean: Desire for DOM encapsulation while allowing page styles to cascade into the shadow tree. For complaints about lack of adoption of mode: open-stylable shadow roots, combine with browser_support.

entity.name: Cross‑root mutations
entity.description: Observing changes across open shadow roots without manually traversing the composed tree.
entity.descriptionClean: Observing changes across open shadow roots without manually traversing the composed tree.

entity.name: HTML Reuse
entity.description: Pain points related to reusing and modularizing HTML content.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to reusing and modularizing HTML content.

entity.name: Templating
entity.description: Lack of templating
entity.descriptionClean: Lack of templating

entity.name: Native templating
entity.description: HTML‑level template syntax (e.g., interpolation/conditionals/loops) without third‑party libraries.
entity.descriptionClean: HTML‑level template syntax (e.g., interpolation/conditionals/loops) without third‑party libraries.

entity.name: JSX‑like templating
entity.description: JSX‑style or similar declarative authoring for component templates.
entity.descriptionClean: JSX‑style or similar declarative authoring for component templates.

entity.name: Template Instantiation / DOM Parts
entity.description: Template Instantiation / DOM Parts for efficient, incremental updates without a VDOM.
entity.descriptionClean: Template Instantiation / DOM Parts for efficient, incremental updates without a VDOM.

entity.name: Interop issues
entity.description: Browser support issues, implementation bugs, cross‑browser implementation differences or inconsistencies, browser prioritization, speed of adoption of new features, any issues where specific browsers, browser engines, or browser companies are mentioned (and it’s not to praise them).
entity.descriptionClean: Browser support issues, implementation bugs, cross‑browser implementation differences or inconsistencies, browser prioritization, speed of adoption of new features, any issues where specific browsers, browser engines, or browser companies are mentioned (and it’s not to praise them).

entity.name: Education
entity.description: Issues related to learning new technologies
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to learning new technologies

entity.name: Lack of documentation
entity.description: Lack of documentation or code examples
entity.descriptionClean: Lack of documentation or code examples

entity.name: Accessibility
entity.description: Accessibility improvements
entity.descriptionClean: Accessibility improvements

entity.name: Declarative APIs
entity.description: Complaints about lack of declarative APIs (combine with `limitations`), or current declarative APIs (as a whole) being hard to use (combine with `ergonomics`).
entity.descriptionHtml: Complaints about lack of declarative APIs (combine with limitations), or current declarative APIs (as a whole) being hard to use (combine with ergonomics).
entity.descriptionClean: Complaints about lack of declarative APIs (combine with limitations), or current declarative APIs (as a whole) being hard to use (combine with ergonomics).

entity.name: Server-client communication
entity.description: Issues around server-client integration & communication, server-side rendering, etc.
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues around server-client integration & communication, server-side rendering, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around server-client integration & communication, server-side rendering, etc.

entity.name: SSR & hydration
entity.description: Performance bottlenecks related to the process of making server-rendered HTML interactive on the client using JavaScript frameworks.
entity.descriptionClean: Performance bottlenecks related to the process of making server-rendered HTML interactive on the client using JavaScript frameworks.

entity.name: Reliance on JavaScript
entity.description: Excessive reliance on JavaScript
entity.descriptionClean: Excessive reliance on JavaScript

entity.name: Tooling
entity.description: Issues around third party tools, or lack thereof, including tooling in the browser (extensions, devtools, etc.).
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around third party tools, or lack thereof, including tooling in the browser (extensions, devtools, etc.).

entity.name: IDE support & autocomplete
entity.description: Editor completion/import for custom tags/attributes/parts/events.
entity.descriptionClean: Editor completion/import for custom tags/attributes/parts/events.

entity.name: Community & dev practices
entity.description: Issues related to public perception, community discourse, or web developer practices
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to public perception, community discourse, or web developer practices

entity.name: Loading
entity.description: General issues related to loading page subresources like scripts, stylesheets, and modules, preloading, or loading UX.
entity.descriptionClean: General issues related to loading page subresources like scripts, stylesheets, and modules, preloading, or loading UX.

entity.name: Specific platforms & vendors
entity.description: Issues mentioning specific platforms, operating systems, or browser vendors.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues mentioning specific platforms, operating systems, or browser vendors.

entity.name: Apple
entity.description: Issues specific to Apple as a platform or vendor, and the Apple ecosystem (e.g., Safari, WebKit, iOS).
entity.descriptionClean: Issues specific to Apple as a platform or vendor, and the Apple ecosystem (e.g., Safari, WebKit, iOS).

entity.name: Invalid/Spam
entity.description: Nonsense or non‑actionable or off-topic content.
entity.descriptionClean: Nonsense or non‑actionable or off-topic content.

entity.name: Declarative Shadow DOM
entity.description: Define shadow trees with HTML, such as when server-side-rendering web components.
entity.descriptionClean: Define shadow trees with HTML, such as when server-side-rendering web components.

example.codeHighlighted: <host-element> <template shadowrootmode="open"> <!-- Shadow content --> </template> </host-element>

resources.title: GitHub - mfreed7/declarative-shadow-dom: Declarative Shadow DOM feature development

webFeature.description_html: The shadowrootmode attribute on <template> creates a shadow root without the use of JavaScript. It is a declarative alternative to the attachShadow() method.
webFeature.name: Declarative shadow DOM

entity.name: DSD reusability
entity.description: The inability to define a Declarative Shadow DOM template once and reuse it across multiple component instances, leading to HTML bloat and poor ergonomics.
entity.descriptionClean: The inability to define a Declarative Shadow DOM template once and reuse it across multiple component instances, leading to HTML bloat and poor ergonomics.

entity.name: Meta-issues
entity.description: Meta-issues not intrinsic to the technology itself or its support in browsers (hardware, spec issues, political issues, etc.).
entity.descriptionClean: Meta-issues not intrinsic to the technology itself or its support in browsers (hardware, spec issues, political issues, etc.).

entity.name: HTML Modules
entity.description: Import HTML files via JS imports and access their elements and JS exports.
entity.descriptionClean: Import HTML files via JS imports and access their elements and JS exports.

example.code:
<script type="module">
	import { TabList } from "./tablist.html" with { type: 'html' };
	customElements.define("tab-list", TabList);
</script>
example.codeHighlighted: <script type="module"> import { TabList } from "./tablist.html" with { type: 'html' }; customElements.define("tab-list", TabList); </script>

entity.name: Performance
entity.description: Performance issues
entity.descriptionClean: Performance issues

entity.name: Declarative data binding
entity.description: The lack of a native, declarative way to bind component state/properties to its template, causing template updates to be manual and imperative.
entity.descriptionClean: The lack of a native, declarative way to bind component state/properties to its template, causing template updates to be manual and imperative.

entity.name: TypeScript
entity.description: A superset of JavaScript that compiles to clean JavaScript output.
entity.descriptionClean: A superset of JavaScript that compiles to clean JavaScript output.

entity.name: Declarative Custom Elements
entity.description: Create web components declaratively through HTML, with or without JS.
entity.descriptionClean: Create web components declaratively through HTML, with or without JS.

example.codeHighlighted: <definition name="progress-ring"> <template shadowmode="open"> <div id="base" role="progressbar" aria-valuemin="0" aria-valuemax="100" aria-valuenow="{{root.attributes.percentage.value}}"> <slot>{{ root.attributes.percentage.value }}%</slot> </div> <style>#base { /* ... */ }</style> </template> </definition> <progress-ring value="50"></progress-ring>

entity.name: Not applicable
entity.description: No use cases, no pain, no issues.
entity.descriptionClean: No use cases, no pain, no issues.

entity.name: Environments & Consumers
entity.description: Issues relevant to specific environments or consumers of web content, e.g. devices, bots, viewing modes, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues relevant to specific environments or consumers of web content, e.g. devices, bots, viewing modes, etc.

entity.name: Reader mode
entity.description: Issues around consuming website content in reader modes, both with those built-in to browsers and via third-party extensions/apps.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around consuming website content in reader modes, both with those built-in to browsers and via third-party extensions/apps.

entity.name: Web Components State management
entity.description: Issues around managing state within and between components, including the lack of built-in solutions and integration with external state management libraries.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around managing state within and between components, including the lack of built-in solutions and integration with external state management libraries.

entity.name: Workplace issues
entity.description: Issues around getting one’s workplace to agree on certain policies and/or priorities.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around getting one’s workplace to agree on certain policies and/or priorities.

entity.name: Reliability
entity.description: Crashes, device/context loss, flaky behavior, and error handling.
entity.descriptionClean: Crashes, device/context loss, flaky behavior, and error handling.

entity.name: Security & privacy
entity.description: Lack of security and privacy
entity.descriptionClean: Lack of security and privacy

entity.name: Component-Based Architecture
entity.description: Pain points related to building websites with a component-based model, such as state management, content composition, and framework reliance. Combine with `accessibility`  for accessibility challenges that are specific to or exacerbated by component-based development (e.g., managing heading levels, generating unique IDs).
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to building websites with a component-based model, such as state management, content composition, and framework reliance. Combine with accessibility for accessibility challenges that are specific to or exacerbated by component-based development (e.g., managing heading levels, generating unique IDs).
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to building websites with a component-based model, such as state management, content composition, and framework reliance. Combine with accessibility  for accessibility challenges that are specific to or exacerbated by component-based development (e.g., managing heading levels, generating unique IDs).

entity.name: Unclear
entity.description: Not enough information to determine what the pain point is.
entity.descriptionClean: Not enough information to determine what the pain point is.

entity.name: Reference Target API
entity.description: A way to “redirect” id references to a component to elements in its shadow DOM (for ARIA, labels, popovers etc).
entity.descriptionClean: A way to “redirect” id references to a component to elements in its shadow DOM (for ARIA, labels, popovers etc).

example.codeHighlighted: this.attachShadow({ mode: "open", referenceTarget: "real-input", }); this.shadowRoot.innerHTML = `<input id="real-input">`;

entity.name: `:has-slotted`
entity.description: CSS pseudo-class that allows targeting `<slot>` elements only when they have slotted nodes.
entity.descriptionHtml: CSS pseudo-class that allows targeting <slot> elements only when they have slotted nodes.
entity.descriptionClean: CSS pseudo-class that allows targeting <slot> elements only when they have slotted nodes.

webFeature.description_html: The :has-slotted CSS pseudo-class matches <slot> elements where the fallback content is not shown. The pseudo-class matches any slotted content, including white space, text nodes, or elements.
webFeature.name: :has-slotted

entity.name: Vendor politics
entity.description: Pain points arising from the strategic decisions, priorities, or market position of browser vendors or platform owners (e.g. Apple, Google).
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points arising from the strategic decisions, priorities, or market position of browser vendors or platform owners (e.g. Apple, Google).

entity.name: Debugging
entity.description: Debugging issues
entity.descriptionClean: Debugging issues

entity.name: Inconsistencies across web platform features
entity.description: E.g. poor integration between different features or web technologies
entity.descriptionClean: E.g. poor integration between different features or web technologies

entity.name: `popover` attribute (Popover API)
entity.description: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.
entity.descriptionClean: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.

example.code: Popover content
example.codeHighlighted: <button popovertarget="foo">Toggle the popover</button> <div id="foo" popover>Popover content</div>

resources.title: The Popover API (previously Popup) · Issue #743 · w3ctag/design-reviews · GitHub

webFeature.description_html: The popover HTML attribute creates an overlay to display content on top of other page content. Popovers can be shown declaratively using HTML, or using the showPopover() method.
webFeature.name: Popover
